intro: Pursegloveia ashtonii, commonly known as the Ashtons' purselove, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are usually narrow and pointed, while its flowers range in color from white to pink. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
